column5: In London for a few days for my daughters ringette provincials Looking for some fishing stores to visit we are staying near western fair grounds
When I'm in London I waste time at anglingsports.ca on Highbury. I really like the store, hope you do too.
You're fairly close to Angling Outfitters outside of Woodstock as well.

Angling Sports at 681 Highbury and Dundas Lambeth Rod and Tackle at 2404 Main street in Lambeth.  It's not that far west of Wonderland and Wharncliffe.  Those are about it.   Canadian Tire has increased their fishing section substantially over the past year as well.
Worth the trip to Woodstock. yup

When I'm in London I waste time at anglingsports.ca on Highbury. I really like the store, hope you do too. I was in St. Thomas most of the day Tuesday. Spent the night in London and most of the day there yesterday. I wanted to visit Angling Sports but it wasn't listed in my GPS. Ended up stopping in at Angling Outfitters in Woodstock on the way home. More than worth a look.  On a side note, while in St. Thomas I was parked outside a store waiting for my wife. The adjacent property had many crab apple trees in one the corner  of this large lot. The trees were absolutely filled with Robins. First time in my life, I've seen that many Robins in one place. Seems Spring has sprung.
As mentioned Angling Sports on Highbury is less than 5 minutes away from the Western Fair arenas.

I was in St. Thomas most of the day Tuesday. Spent the night in London and most of the day there yesterday. I wanted to visit Angling Sports but it wasn't listed in my GPS. Ended up stopping in at Angling Outfitters in Woodstock on the way home. More than worth a look.  On a side note, while in St. Thomas I was parked outside a store waiting for my wife. The adjacent property had many crab apple trees in one the corner  of this large lot. The trees were absolutely filled with Robins. First time in my life, I've seen that many Robins in one place. Seems Spring has sprung.  If you are in St.Thomas again check out Dixie Dairy Mart,very good fishing store

If you are in St.Thomas again check out Dixie Dairy Mart,very good fishing store The owner is a very big supporter of the Fishathon for a Cure as well. http://www.fish-a-thon.com/Fish-A-Thon_For_A_Cure/index.html
If you are in St.Thomas again check out Dixie Dairy Mart,very good fishing store Be there again sometime next month. Thanks for the heads up.
